## Comparing Shakespeare's sonnets

### Loading text
```{python}
# setup
import prosodic

# load sonnets
sonnets = prosodic.Text('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/quadrismegistus/prosodic/master/corpora/corppoetry_en/en.shakespeare.txt')
```

### Parsing text


```{python}
# parse sonnets beforehand if customizing
sonnets.parse()

# the parses are here
sonnets.parses
```

### Inspecting parses

By default these parses are shown with one row per parse, but we can also see parses...

#### By syllable

```{python}
sonnets.parses.stats(by='syll')
```

#### By line

```{python}
sonnets.parses.stats(by='line')
```

#### By stanza

```{python}
sonnets.parses.stats(by='stanza')
```

### Results

```{python}
# so we can groupby stanza and average
df = sonnets.parses.stats(by='stanza').sort_values('parse_score')
df
```

#### Examining results



Best sonnet?

```{python}
# now we can look at "best" sonnet
sonnets.stanza84
```

Worst sonnet?

```{python}
# now we can look at "worst" sonnet
sonnets.stanza51
```
